alert.note: Alert for Jewell (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 10:37AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Jewell County through 1115 AM CDT... At 1037 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mankato, or 22 miles north of Beloit, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Mankato around 1045 AM CDT. Montrose around 1055 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Webber and Lovewell State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until noon CDT for north central Kansas.
